mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Railroad stations
Mexican Americans
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Mexican-American Men at Train Station, Southwest United States, ca. 1893
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This photograph a group of seven Mexican-American men in front of a kiosk at a railroad station. Though the location is unknown, it is believed to be in the American southwest (in either Texas, Arizona, or New Mexico) ca 1893. They are clothed in traditional dress, including serape and sombreros. Image faded to yellowish tan with darker brown at right side
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: George Mason University Libraries Special Collections Research Center
